channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #149 - Perl 5.20 released
item.description:
This week had way too much happening in Perl.

Perl 5.20 has been released. It is available from CPAN in source code format. MS Windows users can already download Strawberry Perl 5.20.0.1

Mojolicious Five Point Oh has been released.

The 2014 edition of the Modern Perl book has been published

New developer tool: perlmodules.net

Oh, and Parrot had a new release too.

YAPC::NA finally has a preliminary version of its schedule. It also has a list of courses available before and after the conference.

The first Perl Workshop in Granada, Spain, and the next YAPC::Asia in Tokyo have also been announced.
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
item.description: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection webÂ applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committedÂ to flawless work and customer service.

item.title: CPAN Testers on Gittip
item.description: Barbie got control over the Twitter account called @cpantesters, and now he has set up a Gittip account as well. By supporting the team you help with the maintenance of the servers and infrastructure of the CPAN Testers.

item.title: perl 5.20 released
item.description: Many improvements, including experimental Subroutine signatures. Go ahead compile it from source and start using it. Soon after the announcement David Farrell posted a short overview of what you need to know about perl 5.20.

item.title: Mojolicious 5.0 released: Perl real-time web framework
item.description: Right on the heels of the first Mojolicious conference (Mojoconf) Sebastian Riedel announced the new version.

item.title: New developer tool: perlmodules.net
item.description: Use this if you'd like to get alerted when one of the dependencies of your application has a new version.

item.title: Modification of a read-only value attempted
item.description: While refactoring a large code-base, domm has encountered this error. It turns out it was a bug in DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader clobbering $_. Besides that, I'd say: Using $_ explicitly is usually not a good idea.

item.title: Introspection in Devel::Trepan
item.description: Listing names of functions while debugging by Rocky Bernstein.

item.title: Reading Code - Camel-Snake-Kebab
item.description: Eric Johnson is converting variable names among CamelCase, snake_case, and kebab-case.

item.title: Perl Catalyst - Concepts, Components and (use) Cases.
MojoConf 2014 Recap
item.description: Joel Berger attended the first Mojoconf.

item.title: Database Unit-Testing with PGTAP
item.description: TAP is one of the awesome things born out of the Perl ecosystem that turned out to be nifty enough to sneak out and colonize other projects. Su-Shee talks here of its use with databases, Postgres, more specifically. ~yanick

item.title: Writing Webapps with Perl Dancer
item.description: A 50 min introduction to Perl Dancer, by Yanick Champoux, the other editor of the Perl Weekly.

item.title: Perl Data Language (PDL)
item.description: 20 minute talk by Jan Hoogenraad for scientists.

item.title: Dancer Status 2014
item.description: Sawyer X, on the state of the dance floor these days. 20 min talk

item.title: 2014.21: NLPW2014 recordings, release, optimization, GTK and Cairo
item.description: The regular Perl 6 weekly by Timo Paulssen.

item.title: Planet Moose - May 2014
item.description: The monthly report about Moose, Mouse, Moo, p5-mop, and a few other OOP related things by Toby Inkster.

item.title: Introduction to Moose Class at YAPC::NA 2014
item.description: Dave Rolsky is going to give an introduction to Moose at YAPC::NA. I strongly recommend his course!

item.title: How to build a dynamic web application using PSGI
item.description: A simple example creating an application that can echo a string.
